channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14266] RegionServers have a lock contention of Configuration.getProps
item.description:
Here's an extract from thread dump of the RegionServer of my cluster:


...

Thread 267 (RW.default.readRpcServer.handler=184,queue=15,port=60020):

  State: BLOCKED

  Blocked count: 204028

  Waited count: 9702639

  Blocked on org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration@5a5e3da

  Blocked by 250 (RW.default.readRpcServer.handler=167,queue=18,port=60020)

  Stack:

    org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration.getProps(Configuration.java:2250)

    org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration.get(Configuration.java:861)

    org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration.getTrimmed(Configuration.java:880)

    org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration.getBoolean(Configuration.java:1281)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.StoreScanner.<init>(StoreScanner.java:138)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.StoreScanner.<init>(StoreScanner.java:157)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HStore.createScanner(HStore.java:1804)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HStore.getScanner(HStore.java:1794)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion$RegionScannerImpl.<init>(HRegion.java:3852)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.instantiateRegionScanner(HRegion.java:1952)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.getScanner(HRegion.java:1938)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.getScanner(HRegion.java:1915)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.get(HRegion.java:4872)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.get(HRegion.java:4847)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegionServer.get(HRegionServer.java:2918)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.protobuf.generated.ClientProtos$ClientService$2.callBlockingMethod(ClientProtos.java:29921)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcServer.call(RpcServer.java:2031)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.CallRunner.run(CallRunner.java:108)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcExecutor.consumerLoop(RpcExecutor.java:116)

    org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcExecutor$1.run(RpcExecutor.java:96)

...

There are such many threads in the thread dump.
I think that RegionServers have a lock contention which causes performance issue.
item.summary: RegionServers have a lock contention of Configuration.getProps

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I attached the thread dump file.
One potential solution is to cache the config parameters retrieved from conf in global data structure of StoreScanner so that we don't need to read the config parameters at every ctor call.

One potential solution is to cache the config parameters retrieved from conf in global data structure of StoreScanner so that we don't need to read the config parameters at every ctor call.

We did a similar thing for Connection in HBASE-12128
HBASE-12912 is a similar issue. I am running tests right now for a fix, if clean will push patch.
Adding Quick Patch, more configuration props should be added in over time. This is specifically for the synchronization issue.
Assigned to Jeff, he will make changes based on feedback.
Jeff, I was slamming this in too fast. There is logical problems with the executorService, can you fix?
Marking critical. I see this too in my tests of heavy random read.
Are you still working on this Jeff Cunningham? If not I can take it.
Please do Andrew. Thanks.
Ok
Since the current patch on this issue addresses the same contention point as HBASE-12912, I made HBASE-12912 a subtask and will look at that first.
I'm having a go at a patch Andrew Purtell Give me a few minutes. Want to use ScanInfo instead of RegionConfiguration.
Ok. I'm off doing something else now anyway. Assign away!

Same idea but use ScanInfo instead of a new RegionConfiguration.

Trying on cluster to ensure it removes the config lookup as a point of contention.

Same idea but use ScanInfo instead of a new RegionConfiguration.

Looks great, I was going to do something similar rather than introduce a new type.

+1 assuming profiling shows the expected improvement
If this works we can close the subtask as a dup I think

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12768396/14266v2.patch
against master branch at commit f34011860e04fd1261b3b30cab0265016a22faa2.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12768396

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 36 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.6.1 2.7.0 2.7.1)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 checkstyle. The applied patch generated 1733 checkstyle errors (more than the master's current 1732 errors).

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn post-site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mob.compactions.TestMobCompactor
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mob.compactions.TestPartitionedMobCompactor
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestMobStoreCompaction
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestDefaultMemStore
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestStoreScanner
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestReversibleScanners

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16200//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16200//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16200//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16200//console

This message is automatically generated.

Looks pretty good.

Typo?


+    this.minVersions = scanInfo.getMaxVersions();

This is not done in the patch, no? I mean we cache hot configs, but HConfiguration itself does not do that by itself. 


+ * Also caches hot configs.

tableMaxRowSize is a better name since it is not a key? 


+  private long tableMaxRowSizeKey;

This logic is not the same? Not sure whether it matters with small scans, but just making sure we are not making semantic changes. 


-      this.scanUsePread = conf.getBoolean("hbase.storescanner.use.pread", scan.isSmall());

+     this.scanUsePread = scan.isSmall()? true: scanInfo.isUsePread();

We don't need tmp param in ScanInfo, this logic can go inside the ScanInfo initialization: 


+     this.cellsPerHeartbeatCheck = scanInfo.getTmpCellsPerTimeoutCheck() > 0?

+       scanInfo.getTmpCellsPerTimeoutCheck(): DEFAULT_HBASE_CELLS_SCANNED_PER_HEARTBEAT_CHECK;

there is an indentation fix needed.

This is coming from the old code, but a return here is dangerous since if anybody adds code afterwards, it will get silently ignored: 


+       if (rsService == null || !scanInfo.isParallelSeekEnabled()) return;
So, patch seems to remove this as point of contention. Using flight recorder, sampling for a minute, it shows in the first sample where no patch but not in the second w/ patch applied.
Thanks for the nice review Enis Soztutar Addressed in v3.

This message is automatically generated.
CI found prob in my patch. Let me fix.
Address NPEs. Its possible for us to have a StoreScanner but there is no Store involved! (Tests and Mob do it). Fix. Meantime, do what we used to do where we'd check for null store before using it.

Pushed to branch-1.2+
Tried going back to branch-1.1 but a few bits wouldn't go in... If someone wants it back in 1.1, make a patch to backport. Thanks.
